results.content: Max es muy bueno, muy hábil, se nota el esfuerzo en la preparación del material, lo cual agradezco mucho, me ayudó a reforzar conceptos en la gestión de modelos, vistas, forms; compartir conocimientos sobre sessions y el despliegue fue un gran aporte. Cosas que esperaba ver y que ojalá las pueda incluir más adelante: 1) trabajar con virtualenvs desde del comienzo, pudo ser con pipenv; 2) incluir sistema de autenticación, considerando recuperación de contraseña y notificación email, uso de decoradores, señales; 3) implementar update and delete en los ejemplos; 4) incluir en el desplieque la gestión del email backend; 5) la sección de desplieque es algo pesada, quizás se pudo preparar más; 6) la sección final no es del todo opcional, algunos detalles no se presentaron en las secciones anteriores; 7) algo de interacción con JavaScript, se nota que Max tiene un gran dominio en este lenguaje. GRACIAS Max!
results.content_html: Max es muy bueno, muy hábil, se nota el esfuerzo en la preparación del material, lo cual agradezco mucho, me ayudó a reforzar conceptos en la gestión de modelos, vistas, forms; compartir conocimientos sobre sessions y el despliegue fue un gran aporte. Cosas que esperaba ver y que ojalá las pueda incluir más adelante: 1) trabajar con virtualenvs desde del comienzo, pudo ser con pipenv; 2) incluir sistema de autenticación, considerando recuperación de contraseña y notificación email, uso de decoradores, señales; 3) implementar update and delete en los ejemplos; 4) incluir en el desplieque la gestión del email backend; 5) la sección de desplieque es algo pesada, quizás se pudo preparar más; 6) la sección final no es del todo opcional, algunos detalles no se presentaron en las secciones anteriores; 7) algo de interacción con JavaScript, se nota que Max tiene un gran dominio en este lenguaje. GRACIAS Max!

results.content: The course is well structured and presented by Max that I'm encouraged to give it more and more time everyday without getting bored. I'm already starting my own project while still almost 40% to finish the course. good job there man.
results.content_html: The course is well structured and presented by Max that I'm encouraged to give it more and more time everyday without getting bored. I'm already starting my own project while still almost 40% to finish the course. good job there man.

results.content:
Max has done an excellent job on this course. The content is thoughtfully structured and gradually increases your knowledge on the subjects as it progresses. 

Max also shows the manual way before going into the more automated ways - this is great to build confidence to actually use these skills in the real world. The full topics selected are the right mix of building the foundation of what's needed in Django (even including up to deployment), allowing students go on to learn more advanced topics based on Django, like REST/user area etc.

Overall I really enjoyed this course - it shines with German precision and planning! Thanks Max!
results.content_html:
Max has done an excellent job on this course. The content is thoughtfully structured and gradually increases your knowledge on the subjects as it progresses.

Max also shows the manual way before going into the more automated ways - this is great to build confidence to actually use these skills in the real world. The full topics selected are the right mix of building the foundation of what's needed in Django (even including up to deployment), allowing students go on to learn more advanced topics based on Django, like REST/user area etc.

Overall I really enjoyed this course - it shines with German precision and planning! Thanks Max!

results.content_html:

results.content:
This course offers a solid fundament for Django. You will learn almost everything about Vanilla Django.

However, I have to deduce a point on lacking of Authentication and Unit Testing which are essential for web development.

If you're at an intermediate level  or higher and is looking for developing RESTful APIs, this is NOT for you. Go for another course.

To sum up, this course is for a beginner who wants to experience Django (templating, static files, basic HTTP requests, models) before getting into more advanced topics (RESTful APIs, Auth, etc.).
results.content_html:
This course offers a solid fundament for Django. You will learn almost everything about Vanilla Django.

However, I have to deduce a point on lacking of Authentication and Unit Testing which are essential for web development.

If you're at an intermediate level or higher and is looking for developing RESTful APIs, this is NOT for you. Go for another course.

To sum up, this course is for a beginner who wants to experience Django (templating, static files, basic HTTP requests, models) before getting into more advanced topics (RESTful APIs, Auth, etc.).

results.content_html: Lacks a lot of topics like working with separate frontend app, building rest apis (which are in practice most used these days, and since it's a "practical guide", it would be good to have them here). The course is good but although it's quite long, it's not as comprehensive as for example the NodeJS course from the same author.

results.content:
I am returning to web development from 20 years ago. After researching Python/Django appears to be the best framework and your course looks like it will fulfill everything I need to get started (again). Looking forward to learning from you. Best wishes Paul

Update from halfway through.
Going through the basics and then reapplying what you have taught to a project helped me understand how much of the code is now taken care of through Django.
Learning a lot, thanks

results.content: I have been learning Django for the past year and building a personal project for implementation at work. I have purchased countless books, udemy videos, conducted tremendous stackoverflow and reddit searches, youtube videos and the like. Now I came to Max's course on Django and I was blow away. The level of detail that is being explained and immense. He tells you want is being done and why and in create detail. Actually going through his course fills me with regret that I didn't start my Django journey with him. I recommend anyone who wants to start with Django to get this course.

results.content:
Pretty basic course. 
Well explained features.

But I don't understand why there is no login view and no options for adding a new post - it's all done from admin panel.

I was also hopping to see how to manage different user profiles - different user would have it's own posts but as I said there is no login option...

results.content:
I am grateful for the  topics that I have learnt, which are not shown even on other video tuts on YouTube & beyond. 

But as you move down the course and getting no clear answers to questions in Q&A, the rating plummets. Still for the quality of the existing content, it deserves a [4.0]. But since I expected a Git based workflow and a better understanding deployment options and it was not there, the rating gets a [3.541 ;]

Pros: Good examples, Great explanations, well organised course. 

Cons: 
0. Looks biased towards AWS

1. Security & Deployment: Just glanced over. Even If you ask questions about it like using .env files, there is usually no response. 

2. Missing Topics like Using Inlines for customising  Django Admin, Authorization, Middleware, Unit Testing & Mocks, not showing the industry standard of a Git based workflow of pushing only changes instead of zipping the entire source-code and uploading and such...

For a "Practical Guide", Q&A could get better, sometimes the Teaching assistant just wants to post a reply for the sake of posting a reply or gives no reply at all as if they don't care.
 
What could make it better: 
1. An additional advanced course on the missing topics including AWS+Git since a version control based workflow is a standard practice. 

2. Since the course projects used are the same as in Django documentation, it would have been more useful if the course included topics contained in Django documentation, effectively rendering this course as a supplement or Lite version of the Official Django documentation. 

3. Q&A needs a Teaching assistant as energetic and excited as the Author.
results.content_html:
I am grateful for the topics that I have learnt, which are not shown even on other video tuts on YouTube & beyond.

But as you move down the course and getting no clear answers to questions in Q&A, the rating plummets. Still for the quality of the existing content, it deserves a [4.0]. But since I expected a Git based workflow and a better understanding deployment options and it was not there, the rating gets a [3.541 ;]

Pros: Good examples, Great explanations, well organised course.

Cons:
0. Looks biased towards AWS

1. Security & Deployment: Just glanced over. Even If you ask questions about it like using .env files, there is usually no response.

2. Missing Topics like Using Inlines for customising Django Admin, Authorization, Middleware, Unit Testing & Mocks, not showing the industry standard of a Git based workflow of pushing only changes instead of zipping the entire source-code and uploading and such...

For a "Practical Guide", Q&A could get better, sometimes the Teaching assistant just wants to post a reply for the sake of posting a reply or gives no reply at all as if they don't care.

What could make it better:
1. An additional advanced course on the missing topics including AWS+Git since a version control based workflow is a standard practice.

2. Since the course projects used are the same as in Django documentation, it would have been more useful if the course included topics contained in Django documentation, effectively rendering this course as a supplement or Lite version of the Official Django documentation.

3. Q&A needs a Teaching assistant as energetic and excited as the Author.

results.content: I've bought over 10+ Udemy courses and I hate leaving bad reviews, but this course is horrible. He says he follow the "DRY" rule, but all he does is repeat himself. The course could've been WAY shorter. He flies from folder to folder like a mad man, it's hard to follow what's going on. He should've stuck with the most efficient way to do implement whatever for each lecture and slowly explain that method instead of flying through a million different useless implementations. There's also no User Authentication/ Login section and no REST. I can't even get a refund because he drags on for so long...
results.content_html: I've bought over 10+ Udemy courses and I hate leaving bad reviews, but this course is horrible. He says he follow the "DRY" rule, but all he does is repeat himself. The course could've been WAY shorter. He flies from folder to folder like a mad man, it's hard to follow what's going on. He should've stuck with the most efficient way to do implement whatever for each lecture and slowly explain that method instead of flying through a million different useless implementations. There's also no User Authentication/ Login section and no REST. I can't even get a refund because he drags on for so long...
